derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in the sense 'rural'): from Latin rusticus, from rus 'the country'

entry.tran: 乡村的;质朴的;有乡村风味的
entry.def: You can use rustic to describe things or people that you approve of because they are simple or unsophisticated in a way that is typical of the countryside.

example.ex: ...the rustic charm of a country lifestyle.
...a half dozen or so wonderfully rustic old log cabins.
example.tran: 大约6个颇具乡土风味的古老的小木屋

entry.def: You can refer to someone who comes from the countryside as a rustic if you find their behaviour amusing or very different from that of people who live in towns and cities.

example.ex: ...lots of opera-loving Italian rustics in from the country.
example.tran: 许多从乡下来的热爱歌剧的意大利乡巴佬

sentences.sentence: "the nightlife of Montmartre awed the unsophisticated tourists"

means.word_mean: 4. characteristic of the fields or country;
